neighbors.name: Commonwealth of Virginia Board of Game & Inland Fisheries
neighbors.claims: The Commonwealth of Virginia’s Board of Game & Inland Fisheries is the state agency responsible for managing inland wildlife and fisheries (now the Department of Wildlife Resources) [Virginia DWR](https://dwr.virginia.gov/about/). In 2017, this agency paid $9 million for roughly 2,900 acres in western Spotsylvania (Oakley Forest WMA) to conserve it as a new Wildlife Management Area [Outdoors Rambler](https://www.outdoorsrambler.com/post/2017/11/29/virginia-opening-wildlife-management-area-in-spotsylvania-county-needed-access).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate through formal agency channels, emphasizing wildlife habitat protections and regulatory compliance.

overview_summary: The only adjacent landowner identified is a state agency with no public stance on local development (0 support, 0 oppose, 1 unknown). This government entity wields high influence as a major landowner and wildlife regulatory authority in the community.
